links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We're calling this opening segment Achieving Prosperity.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And central to that is jobs.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: There are two economic realities in America today.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: There’s been a record six straight years of job growth, and new census numbers show incomes have increased at a record rate after years of stagnation.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: However, income inequality remains significant, and nearly half of Americans are living paycheck to paycheck.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Beginning with you, Secretary Clinton, why are you a better choice than your opponent to create the kinds of jobs that will put more money into the pockets of American workers?

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Well, thank you, Lester, and thanks to Hofstra for hosting us.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: The central question in this election is really what kind of country we want to be and what kind of future we’ll build together.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Today is my granddaughter’s second birthday, so I think about this a lot.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: First, we have to build an economy that works for everyone, not just those at the top.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: That means we need new jobs, good jobs, with rising incomes.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I want us to invest in you.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I want us to invest in your future.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: That means jobs in infrastructure, in advanced manufacturing, innovation and technology, clean, renewable energy, and small business, because most of the new jobs will come from small business.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We also have to make the economy fairer.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: That starts with raising the national minimum wage and also guarantee, finally, equal pay for women’s work.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I also want to see more companies do profit-sharing.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: If you help create the profits, you should be able to share in them, not just the executives at the top.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And I want us to do more to support people who are struggling to balance family and work.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I’ve heard from so many of you about the difficult choices you face and the stresses that you’re under.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: So let’s have paid family leave, earned sick days.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Let’s be sure we have affordable child care and debt-free college.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: How we’re going to do it?

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We’re going to do it by having the wealthy pay their fair share and close the corporate loopholes.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Finally, we tonight are on the stage together, Donald Trump and I.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Donald, it’s good to be with you.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We’re going to have a debate where we are talking about the important issues facing our country.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: You have to judge us, who can shoulder the immense, awesome responsibilities of the presidency, who can put into action the plans that will make your life better.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I hope that I will be able to earn your vote on November 8th.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Secretary Clinton, thank you.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Mr. Trump, the same question to you.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: It’s about putting money, more money into the pockets of American workers.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: You have up to two minutes.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Thank you, Lester.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Our jobs are fleeing the country.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: They’re going to Mexico.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: They’re going to many other countries.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: You look at what China is doing to our country in terms of making our product.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: They’re devaluing their currency, and there’s nobody in our government to fight them.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And we have a very good fight.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And we have a winning fight.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Because they’re using our country as a piggy bank to rebuild China, and many other countries are doing the same thing.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: So we’re losing our good jobs, so many of them.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: When you look at what’s happening in Mexico, a friend of mine who builds plants said it’s the eighth wonder of the world.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: They’re building some of the biggest plants anywhere in the world, some of the most sophisticated, some of the best plants.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: With the United States, as he said, not so much.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: So Ford is leaving.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: You see that, their small car division leaving.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Thousands of jobs leaving Michigan, leaving Ohio.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: They’re all leaving.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And we can’t allow it to happen anymore.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: As far as child care is concerned and so many other things, I think Hillary and I agree on that.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We probably disagree a little bit as to numbers and amounts and what we’re going to do, but perhaps we’ll be talking about that later.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: But we have to stop our jobs from being stolen from us.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We have to stop our companies from leaving the United States and, with it, firing all of their people.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: All you have to do is take a look at Carrier air conditioning in Indianapolis.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: They left fired 1,400 people.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: They’re going to Mexico.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: So many hundreds and hundreds of companies are doing this.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We cannot let it happen.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Under my plan, I’ll be reducing taxes tremendously, from 35 percent to 15 percent for companies, small and big businesses.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: That’s going to be a job creator like we haven’t seen since Ronald Reagan.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: It’s going to be a beautiful thing to watch.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Companies will come.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: They will build.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: They will expand.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: New companies will start.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And I look very, very much forward to doing it.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We have to renegotiate our trade deals, and we have to stop these countries from stealing our companies and our jobs.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Secretary Clinton, would you like to respond?

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Well, I think that trade is an important issue.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Of course, we are 5 percent of the world’s population; we have to trade with the other 95 percent.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And we need to have smart, fair trade deals.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We also, though, need to have a tax system that rewards work and not just financial transactions.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And the kind of plan that Donald has put forth would be trickle-down economics all over again.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: In fact, it would be the most extreme version, the biggest tax cuts for the top percent of the people in this country than we’ve ever had.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I call it trumped-up trickle-down, because that’s exactly what it would be.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: That is not how we grow the economy.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We just have a different view about what’s best for growing the economy, how we make investments that will actually produce jobs and rising incomes.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I think at it, from somewhat different perspectives.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I understand that.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: You know, Donald was very fortunate in his life, and that’s all to his benefit.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: He started his business with $14 million, borrowed from his father, and he really believes that the more you help wealthy people, the better off we’ll be and that everything will work out from there.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I don’t buy that.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I have a different experience.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: My father was a small-businessman.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: He worked really hard.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: He printed drapery fabrics on long tables, where he pulled out those fabrics and he went down with a silkscreen and dumped the paint in and took the squeegee and kept going.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And so what I believe is the more we can do for the middle class, the more we can invest in you, your education, your skills, your future, the better we will be off and the better we’ll grow.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: That’s the kind of economy I want us to see again.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Let me follow up with Mr. Trump, if you can.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: You’ve talked about creating 25 million jobs, and you’ve promised to bring back millions of jobs for Americans.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: How are you going to bring back the industries that have left this country for cheaper labor overseas?

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: How, specifically, are you going to tell American manufacturers that you have to come back?

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Well, for one thing and before we start on that my father gave me a very small loan in 1975, and I built it into a company that’s worth many, many billions of dollars, with some of the greatest assets in the world, and I say that only because that’s the kind of thinking that our country needs.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Our country’s in deep trouble.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We don’t know what we’re doing when it comes to devaluations and all of these countries all over the world, especially China.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: They’re the best, the best ever, at it.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: What they’re doing to us is a very, very sad thing.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We have to renegotiate our trade deals.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And, Lester, they’re taking our jobs, they’re giving incentives, they’re doing things that, frankly, we don’t do.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Let me give you the example of Mexico.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: They have a VAT tax.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We’re on a different system.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: When we sell into Mexico, there’s a tax.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: When they sell in an automatic, 16 percent, approximately.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: When they sell into us, there’s no tax.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: It’s a defective agreement.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: It’s been defective for a long time, many years, but the politicians haven’t done anything about it.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Now, in all fairness to Secretary Clinton, yes, is that OK?

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I want you to be very happy.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: It’s very important to me.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: But in all fairness to Secretary Clinton, when she started talking about this, it was really very recently.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: She’s been doing this for 30 years.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And why hasn’t she made the agreements better?

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: The NAFTA agreement is defective.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Just because of the tax and many other reasons, but just because of the fact...

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Let me interrupt just a moment, but...

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Secretary Clinton and others, politicians, should have been doing this for years, not right now, because of the fact that we’ve created a movement.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: They should have been doing this for years.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: What’s happened to our jobs and our country and our economy generally is look, we owe $20 trillion.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We cannot do it any longer, Lester.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Back to the question, though.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: How do you bring back specifically bring back jobs, American manufacturers?

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: How do you make them bring the jobs back?

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Well, the first thing you do is don’t let the jobs leave.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: The companies are leaving.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I could name, I mean, there are thousands of them.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: They’re leaving, and they’re leaving in bigger numbers than ever.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And what you do is you say, fine, you want to go to Mexico or some other country, good luck.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We wish you a lot of luck.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: But if you think you’re going to make your air conditioners or your cars or your cookies or whatever you make and bring them into our country without a tax, you’re wrong.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And once you say you’re going to have to tax them coming in, and our politicians never do this, because they have special interests and the special interests want those companies to leave, because in many cases, they own the companies.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: So what I’m saying is, we can stop them from leaving.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We have to stop them from leaving.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And that’s a big, big factor.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Let me let Secretary Clinton get in here.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Well, let’s stop for a second and remember where we were eight years ago.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We had the worst financial crisis, the Great Recession, the worst since the 1930s.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: That was in large part because of tax policies that slashed taxes on the wealthy, failed to invest in the middle class, took their eyes off of Wall Street, and created a perfect storm.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: In fact, Donald was one of the people who rooted for the housing crisis.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: He said, back in 2006, Gee, I hope it does collapse, because then I can go in and buy some and make some money.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Well, it did collapse.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: That’s called business, by the way.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Nine million people, nine million people lost their jobs.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Five million people lost their homes.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And $13 trillion in family wealth was wiped out.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Now, we have come back from that abyss.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And it has not been easy.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: So we’re now on the precipice of having a potentially much better economy, but the last thing we need to do is to go back to the policies that failed us in the first place.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Independent experts have looked at what I’ve proposed and looked at what Donald’s proposed, and basically they’ve said this, that if his tax plan, which would blow up the debt by over $5 trillion and would in some instances disadvantage middle-class families compared to the wealthy, were to go into effect, we would lose 3.5 million jobs and maybe have another recession.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: They’ve looked at my plans and they’ve said, OK, if we can do this, and I intend to get it done, we will have 10 million more new jobs, because we will be making investments where we can grow the economy.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Take clean energy.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Some country is going to be the clean-energy superpower of the 21st century.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Donald thinks that climate change is a hoax perpetrated by the Chinese.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I think it’s real.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I think science is real.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And I think it’s important that we grip this and deal with it, both at home and abroad.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And here’s what we can do.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We can deploy a half a billion more solar panels.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We can have enough clean energy to power every home.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We can build a new modern electric grid.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: That’s a lot of jobs; that’s a lot of new economic activity.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: So I’ve tried to be very specific about what we can and should do, and I am determined that we’re going to get the economy really moving again, building on the progress we’ve made over the last eight years, but never going back to what got us in trouble in the first place.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Mr. Trump?

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: She talks about solar panels.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We invested in a solar company, our country.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: That was a disaster.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: They lost plenty of money on that one.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Now, look, I’m a great believer in all forms of energy, but we’re putting a lot of people out of work.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Our energy policies are a disaster.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Our country is losing so much in terms of energy, in terms of paying off our debt.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: You can’t do what you’re looking to do with $20 trillion in debt.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: The Obama administration, from the time they’ve come in, is over 230 years worth of debt, and he’s topped it.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: He’s doubled it in a course of almost eight years, seven-and-a-half years, to be semi- exact.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: We have to do a much better job at keeping our jobs.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And we have to do a much better job at giving companies incentives to build new companies or to expand, because they’re not doing it.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And all you have to do is look at Michigan and look at Ohio and look at all of these places where so many of their jobs and their companies are just leaving, they're gone.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And, Hillary, I'd just ask you this.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: You've been doing this for 30 years.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Why are you just thinking about these solutions right now?

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: For 30 years, you've been doing it, and now you're just starting to think of solutions.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I will bring excuse me.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I will bring back jobs.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: You can't bring back jobs.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Well, actually, I have thought about this quite a bit.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Yeah, for 30 years.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And I have well, not quite that long.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I think my husband did a pretty good job in the 1990s.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: I think a lot about what worked and how we can make it work again...

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Well, he approved NAFTA...

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: (CROSSTALK)  CLINTON: ... million new jobs, a balanced budget...

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: He approved NAFTA, which is the single worst trade deal ever approved in this country.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Incomes went up for everybody.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Manufacturing jobs went up also in the 1990s, if we're actually going to look at the facts.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: When I was in the Senate, I had a number of trade deals that came before me, and I held them all to the same test.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Will they create jobs in America?

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Will they raise incomes in America?

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And are they good for our national security?

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: Some of them I voted for.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: The biggest one, a multinational one known as CAFTA, I voted against.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: And because I hold the same standards as I look at all of these trade deals.

links.episode_name: Creating jobs and generating more income for American workers
links.text: But let's not assume that trade is the only challenge we have in the economy.

links.text: Secretary Clinton?

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Well, I think you've seen another example of bait-and- switch here.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: For 40 years, everyone running for president has released their tax returns.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: You can go and see nearly, I think, 39, 40 years of our tax returns, but everyone has done it.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: We know the IRS has made clear there is no prohibition on releasing it when you're under audit.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: So you've got to ask yourself, why won't he release his tax returns?

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And I think there may be a couple of reasons.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: First, maybe he's not as rich as he says he is.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Second, maybe he's not as charitable as he claims to be.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Third, we don't know all of his business dealings, but we have been told through investigative reporting that he owes about $650 million to Wall Street and foreign banks.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: 'r maybe he doesn't want the American people, all of you watching tonight, to know that he's paid nothing in federal taxes, because the only years that anybody's ever seen were a couple of years when he had to turn them over to state authorities when he was trying to get a casino license, and they showed he didn't pay any federal income tax.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: That makes me smart.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: So if he's paid zero, that means zero for troops, zero for vets, zero for schools or health.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And I think probably he's not all that enthusiastic about having the rest of our country see what the real reasons are, because it must be something really important, even terrible, that he's trying to hide.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And the financial disclosure statements, they don't give you the tax rate.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: They don't give you all the details that tax returns would.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And it just seems to me that this is something that the American people deserve to see.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And I have no reason to believe that he's ever going to release his tax returns, because there's something he's hiding.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And we'll guess.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: We'll keep guessing at what it might be that he's hiding.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: But I think the question is, were he ever to get near the White House, what would be those conflicts?

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Who does he owe money to?

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Well, he owes you the answers to that, and he should provide them.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: He also, he also raised the issue of your e-mails.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Do you want to respond to that?

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: You know, I made a mistake using a private e- mail.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: That's for sure.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: But I'm not going to make any excuses.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: It was a mistake, and I take responsibility for that.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Mr. Trump?

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: That was more than a mistake.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: That was done purposely.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: That was not a mistake.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: That was done purposely.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: When you have your staff taking the Fifth Amendment, taking the Fifth so they're not prosecuted, when you have the man that set up the illegal server taking the Fifth, I think it's disgraceful.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And believe me, this country thinks it’s, really thinks it's disgraceful, also.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: As far as my tax returns, you don't learn that much from tax returns.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: You learn a lot from financial disclosure.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: The other thing, I'm extremely underleveraged.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: The report that said $650 which, by the way, a lot of friends of mine that know my business say, boy, that's really not a lot of money.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: It's not a lot of money relative to what I had.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: The buildings that were in question, they said in the same report, which was, actually, it wasn't even a bad story, to be honest with you, but the buildings are worth $3.9 billion.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And the $650 isn't even on that.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: But it's not $650.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: It's much less than that.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: But I could give you a list of banks, I would, if that would help you, I would give you a list of banks.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: These are very fine institutions, very fine banks.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: I could do that very quickly.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: I am very underleveraged.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: I have a great company.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: I have a tremendous income.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And the reason I say that is not in a braggadocios way.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: It's because it's about time that this country had somebody running it that has an idea about money.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: When we have $20 trillion in debt, and our country's a mess, you know, it's one thing to have $20 trillion in debt and our roads are good and our bridges are good and everything's in great shape, our airports.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Our airports are like from a third world country.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: You land at LaGuardia, you land at Kennedy, you land at LAX, you land at Newark, and you come in from Dubai and Qatar and you see these incredible you come in from China, you see these incredible airports, and you land we've become a third world country.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: So the worst of all things has happened.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: We owe $20 trillion, and we're a mess.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: We haven't even started.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And we've spent $6 trillion in the Middle East, according to a report that I just saw.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Whether it's 6 or 5, but it looks like it's 6, $6 trillion in the Middle East, we could have rebuilt our country twice.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And it's really a shame.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And it's politicians like Secretary Clinton that have caused this problem.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Our country has tremendous problems.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: We're a debtor nation.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: We're a serious debtor nation.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And we have a country that needs new roads, new tunnels, new bridges, new airports, new schools, new hospitals.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And we don't have the money, because it's been squandered on so many of your ideas.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: We'll let you respond and we'll move on to the next segment.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And maybe because you haven't paid any federal income tax for a lot of years.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: (APPLAUSE)  And the other thing I think is important...

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: It would be squandered, too, believe me.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: ... is if your, if your main claim to be president of the United States is your business, then I think we should talk about that.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: You know, your campaign manager said that you built a lot of businesses on the backs of little guys.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And, indeed, I have met a lot of the people who were stiffed by you and your businesses, Donald.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: I've met dishwashers, painters, architects, glass installers, marble installers, drapery installers, like my dad was, who you refused to pay when they finished the work that you asked them to do.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: We have an architect in the audience who designed one of your clubhouses at one of your golf courses.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: It's a beautiful facility.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: It immediately was put to use.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And you wouldn't pay what the man needed to be paid, what he was charging you to do...

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Maybe he didn't do a good job and I was unsatisfied with his work...

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Which our country should do, too.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Do the thousands of people that you have stiffed over the course of your business not deserve some kind of apology from someone who has taken their labor, taken the goods that they produced, and then refused to pay them?

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: I can only say that I'm certainly relieved that my late father never did business with you.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: He provided a good middle-class life for us, but the people he worked for, he expected the bargain to be kept on both sides.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And when we talk about your business, you've taken business bankruptcy six times.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: There are a lot of great businesspeople that have never taken bankruptcy once.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: You call yourself the King of Debt.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: You talk about leverage.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: You even at one time suggested that you would try to negotiate down the national debt of the United States.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Wrong.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Well, sometimes there's not a direct transfer of skills from business to government, but sometimes what happened in business would be really bad for government.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Let's let Mr. Trump...

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And we need to be very clear about that.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: So, yeah, I think, I do think it's time.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Look, it's all words, it's all sound bites.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: I built an unbelievable company.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Some of the greatest assets anywhere in the world, real estate assets anywhere in the world, beyond the United States, in Europe, lots of different places.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: It's an unbelievable company.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: But on occasion, four times, we used certain laws that are there.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And when Secretary Clinton talks about people that didn't get paid, first of all, they did get paid a lot, but taken advantage of the laws of the nation.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Now, if you want to change the laws, you've been there a long time, change the laws.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: But I take advantage of the laws of the nation because I'm running a company.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: My obligation right now is to do well for myself, my family, my employees, for my companies.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And that's what I do.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: But what she doesn't say is that tens of thousands of people that are unbelievably happy and that love me.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: I'll give you an example.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: We're just opening up on Pennsylvania Avenue right next to the White House, so if I don't get there one way, I'm going to get to Pennsylvania Avenue another.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: But we're opening the Old Post Office.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: Under budget, ahead of schedule, saved tremendous money.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: I'm a year ahead of schedule.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And that's what this country should be doing.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: We build roads and they cost two and three and four times what they're supposed to cost.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: We buy products for our military and they come in at costs that are so far above what they were supposed to be, because we don't have people that know what they're doing.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: When we look at the budget, the budget is bad to a large extent because we have people that have no idea as to what to do and how to buy.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: The Trump International is way under budget and way ahead of schedule.

links.episode_name: Taxes on the wealthy
links.text: And we should be able to do that for our country.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Well, we're well behind schedule, so I want to move to our next segment.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We move into our next segment talking about America's direction.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And let's start by talking about race.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: The share of Americans who say race relations are bad in this country is the highest it's been in decades, much of it amplified by shootings of African-Americans by police, as we've seen recently in Charlotte and Tulsa.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Race has been a big issue in this campaign, and one of you is going to have to bridge a very wide and bitter gap.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: So how do you heal the divide?

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Secretary Clinton, you get two minutes on this.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Well, you're right.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Race remains a significant challenge in our country.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Unfortunately, race still determines too much, often determines where people live, determines what kind of education in their public schools they can get, and, yes, it determines how they're treated in the criminal justice system.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We've just seen those two tragic examples in both Tulsa and Charlotte.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And we've got to do several things at the same time.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We have to restore trust between communities and the police.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We have to work to make sure that our police are using the best training, the best techniques, that they're well prepared to use force only when necessary.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Everyone should be respected by the law, and everyone should respect the law.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Right now, that's not the case in a lot of our neighborhoods.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: So I have, ever since the first day of my campaign, called for criminal justice reform.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I've laid out a platform that I think would begin to remedy some of the problems we have in the criminal justice system.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: But we also have to recognize, in addition to the challenges that we face with policing, there are so many good, brave police officers who equally want reform.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: So we have to bring communities together in order to begin working on that as a mutual goal.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And we've got to get guns out of the hands of people who should not have them.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: The gun epidemic is the leading cause of death of young African- American men, more than the next nine causes put together.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: So we have to do two things, as I said.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We have to restore trust.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We have to work with the police.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We have to make sure they respect the communities and the communities respect them.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And we have to tackle the plague of gun violence, which is a big contributor to a lot of the problems that we're seeing today.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: All right, Mr. Trump, you have two minutes.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: How do you heal the divide?

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Well, first of all, Secretary Clinton doesn't want to use a couple of words, and that's law and order.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And we need law and order.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: If we don't have it, we're not going to have a country.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And when I look at what's going on in Charlotte, a city I love, a city where I have investments, when I look at what's going on throughout various parts of our country, whether it's I mean, I can just keep naming them all day long we need law and order in our country.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I just got today the, as you know, the endorsement of the Fraternal Order of Police, we just just came in.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We have endorsements from, I think, almost every police group, very I mean, a large percentage of them in the United States.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We have a situation where we have our inner cities, African- Americans, Hispanics are living in he'll because it's so dangerous.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: You walk down the street, you get shot.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: In Chicago, they've had thousands of shootings, thousands since January 1st.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Thousands of shootings.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And I'm saying, where is this?

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Is this a war-torn country?

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And we have to stop the violence.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We have to bring back law and order.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: In a place like Chicago, where thousands of people have been killed, thousands over the last number of years, in fact, almost 4,000 have been killed since Barack Obama became president, over almost 4,000 people in Chicago have been killed.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We have to bring back law and order.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Now, whether or not in a place like Chicago you do stop and frisk, which worked very well, Mayor Giuliani is here, worked very well in New York.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: It brought the crime rate way down.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: But you take the gun away from criminals that shouldn't be having it.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We have gangs roaming the street.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And in many cases, they're illegally here, illegal immigrants.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And they have guns.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And they shoot people.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And we have to be very strong.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And we have to be very vigilant.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We have to be we have to know what we're doing.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Right now, our police, in many cases, are afraid to do anything.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We have to protect our inner cities, because African-American communities are being decimated by crime, decimated.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Your two your two minutes expired, but I do want to follow up.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Stop-and-frisk was ruled unconstitutional in New York, because it largely singled out black and Hispanic young men.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: No, you're wrong.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: It went before a judge, who was a very against-police judge.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And our mayor, our new mayor, refused to go forward with the case.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: If you look at it, throughout the country, there are many places where it's allowed.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: The argument is that it's a form of racial profiling.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: No, the argument is that we have to take the guns away from these people that have them and they are bad people that shouldn't have them.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: These are people that are bad people that shouldn't be, when you have 3,000 shootings in Chicago from January 1st, when you have 4,000 people killed in Chicago by guns, from the beginning of the presidency of Barack Obama, his hometown, you have to have stop-and-frisk.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: You need more police.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: You need a better community, you know, relation.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: You don't have good community relations in Chicago.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: It's terrible.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I have property there.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: It's terrible what's going on in Chicago.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: But when you look and Chicago's not the only you go to Ferguson, you go to so many different places.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: You need better relationships.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I agree with Secretary Clinton on this.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: You need better relationships between the communities and the police, because in some cases, it's not good.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: But you look at Dallas, where the relationships were really studied, the relationships were really a beautiful thing, and then five police officers were killed one night very violently.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: So there's some bad things going on.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Some really bad things.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Secretary Clinton...

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: But we need, Lester, we need law and order.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And we need law and order in the inner cities, because the people that are most affected by what's happening are African-American and Hispanic people.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And it's very unfair to them what our politicians are allowing to happen.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Secretary Clinton?

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Well, I've heard I've heard Donald say this at his rallies, and it's really unfortunate that he paints such a dire negative picture of black communities in our country.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: You know, the vibrancy of the black church, the black businesses that employ so many people, the opportunities that so many families are working to provide for their kids.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: There's a lot that we should be proud of and we should be supporting and lifting up.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: But we do always have to make sure we keep people safe.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: There are the right ways of doing it, and then there are ways that are ineffective.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Stop-and-frisk was found to be unconstitutional and, in part, because it was ineffective.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: It did not do what it needed to do.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Now, I believe in community policing.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And, in fact, violent crime is one-half of what it was in 1991.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Property crime is down 40 percent.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We just don't want to see it creep back up.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We've had 25 years of very good cooperation.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: But there were some problems, some unintended consequences.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Too many young African-American and Latino men ended up in jail for nonviolent offenses.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And it's just a fact that if you're a young African-American man and you do the same thing as a young white man, you are more likely to be arrested, charged, convicted, and incarcerated.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: So we've got to address the systemic racism in our criminal justice system.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We cannot just say law and order.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We have to say we have to come forward with a plan that is going to divert people from the criminal justice system, deal with mandatory minimum sentences, which have put too many people away for too long for doing too little.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We need to have more second chance programs.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I'm glad that we're ending private prisons in the federal system; I want to see them ended in the state system.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: You shouldn't have a profit motivation to fill prison cells with young Americans.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: So there are some positive ways we can work on this.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And I believe strongly that commonsense gun safety measures would assist us.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Right now and this is something Donald has supported, along with the gun lobby right now, we've got too many military- style weapons on the streets.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: In a lot of places, our police are outgunned.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: We need comprehensive background checks, and we need to keep guns out of the hands of those who will do harm.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And we finally need to pass a prohibition on anyone who's on the terrorist watch list from being able to buy a gun in our country.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: If you're too dangerous to fly, you are too dangerous to buy a gun.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: So there are things we can do, and we ought to do it in a bipartisan way.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Secretary Clinton, last week, you said we've got to do everything possible to improve policing, to go right at implicit bias.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Do you believe that police are implicitly biased against black people?

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Lester, I think implicit bias is a problem for everyone, not just police.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I think, unfortunately, too many of us in our great country jump to conclusions about each other.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And therefore, I think we need all of us to be asking hard questions about, you know, why am I feeling this way?

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: But when it comes to policing, since it can have literally fatal consequences, I have said, in my first budget, we would put money into that budget to help us deal with implicit bias by retraining a lot of our police officers.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I've met with a group of very distinguished, experienced police chiefs a few weeks ago.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: They admit it's an issue.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: They've got a lot of concerns.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Mental health is one of the biggest concerns, because now police are having to handle a lot of really difficult mental health problems on the street.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: They want support, they want more training, they want more assistance.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And I think the federal government could be in a position where we would offer and provide that.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Mr. Trump...

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I'd like to respond to that.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: First of all, I agree, and a lot of people even within my own party want to give certain rights to people on watch lists and no- fly lists.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I agree with you.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: When a person is on a watch list or a no-fly list, and I have the endorsement of the NRA, which I'm very proud of.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: These are very, very good people, and they're protecting the Second Amendment.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: But I think we have to look very strongly at no-fly lists and watch lists.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And when people are on there, even if they shouldn't be on there, we 'll help them, we 'll help them legally, we 'll help them get off.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: But I tend to agree with that quite strongly.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I do want to bring up the fact that you were the one that brought up the words super-predator about young black youth.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And that's a term that I think was a it's it's been horribly met, as you know.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I think you've apologized for it.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: But I think it was a terrible thing to say.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And when it comes to stop-and-frisk, you know, you're talking about takes guns away.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Well, I'm talking about taking guns away from gangs and people that use them.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And I don't think I really don't think you disagree with me on this, if you want to know the truth.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I think maybe there's a political reason why you can't say it, but I really don't believe in New York City, stop-and-frisk, we had 2,200 murders, and stop-and-frisk brought it down to 500 murders.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Five hundred murders is a lot of murders.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: It's hard to believe, 500 is like supposed to be good?

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: But we went from 2,200 to 500.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And it was continued on by Mayor Bloomberg.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And it was terminated by current mayor.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: But stop-and- frisk had a tremendous impact on the safety of New York City.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Tremendous beyond belief.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: So when you say it has no impact, it really did.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: It had a very, very big impact.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Well, it's also fair to say, if we're going to talk about mayors, that under the current mayor, crime has continued to drop, including murders.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: No, you're wrong.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: You're wrong.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: No, I'm not.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Murders are up.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: You check it.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: New York New York has done an excellent job.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And I give credit I give credit across the board going back two mayors, two police chiefs, because it has worked.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And other communities need to come together to do what will work, as well.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Look, one murder is too many, but it is important that we learn about what has been effective.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And not go to things that sound good that really did not have the kind of impact that we would want.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Who disagrees with keeping neighborhoods safe?

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: But let's also add, no one should disagree about respecting the rights of young men who live in those neighborhoods.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And so we need to do a better job of working, again, with the communities, faith communities, business communities, as well as the police to try to deal with this problem.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: This conversation is about race.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And so, Mr. Trump, I have to ask you for five...

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I'd like to just respond, if I might.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Please 20 seconds.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I'd just like to respond.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Please respond, then I've got a quick follow-up for you.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Look, the African-American community has been let down by our politicians.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: They talk good around election time, like right now, and after the election, they said, see ya later, I'll see you in four years.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: The African-American community because look, the community within the inner cities has been so badly treated.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: They've been abused and used in order to get votes by Democrat politicians, because that's what it is.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: They've controlled these communities for up to 100 years.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Mr. Trump, let me...

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: (CROSSTALK)  CLINTON: Well, I I do think...

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And I will tell you, you look at the inner cities and I just left Detroit, and I just left Philadelphia, and I just you know, you've seen me, I've been all over the place.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: You decided to stay home, and that's OK.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: But I will tell you, I've been all over.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And I've met some of the greatest people I 'll ever meet within these communities.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And they are very, very upset with what their politicians have told them and what their politicians have done.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: Mr. Trump, I...

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I think I think I think Donald just criticized me for preparing for this debate.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And yes I did, and you know what else I prepared for?

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: I prepared to be president.

links.episode_name: Healing the divide created by racial segregation
links.text: And I think that's a good thing.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: (APPLAUSE)  HOLT: Mr. Trump, for five years, you perpetuated a false claim that the nation's first black president was not a natural-born citizen.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: You questioned his legitimacy.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: In the last couple of weeks, you acknowledged what most Americans have accepted for years: The president was born in the United States.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: Can you tell us what took you so long?

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: I'll tell you very well, just very simple to say.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: Sidney Blumenthal works for the campaign and close very close friend of Secretary Clinton.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And her campaign manager, Patti Doyle, went to during the campaign, her campaign against President Obama, fought very hard.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And you can go look it up, and you can check it out.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And if you look at CNN this past week, Patti Solis Doyle was on Wolf Blitzer saying that this happened.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: Blumenthal sent McClatchy, highly respected reporter at McClatchy, to Kenya to find out about it.
