links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: They were pressing it very hard.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: She failed to get the birth certificate.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: When I got involved, I didn't fail.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: I got him to give the birth certificate.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: So I'm satisfied with it.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And I'll tell you why I'm satisfied with it.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: (CROSSTALK)  TRUMP: Because I want to get on to defeating ISIS, because I want to get on to creating jobs, because I want to get on to having a strong border, because I want to get on to things that are very important to me and that are very important to the country.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: I will let you respond.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: It's important.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: But I just want to get the answer here.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: The birth certificate was produced in 2011.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: You've continued to tell the story and question the president's legitimacy in 2012, O 13, O 14, O 15...

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: .... as recently as January.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: So the question is, what changed your mind?

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: Well, nobody was pressing it, nobody was caring much about it.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: I figured you'd ask the question tonight, of course.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: But nobody was caring much about it.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: But I was the one that got him to produce the birth certificate.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And I think I did a good job.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: Secretary Clinton also fought it.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: I mean, you know now, everybody in mainstream is going to say, oh, that's not true.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: Look, it's true.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: Sidney Blumenthal sent a reporter you just have to take a look at CNN, the last week, the interview with your former campaign manager.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And she was involved.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: But just like she can't bring back jobs, she can't produce.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: I'm sorry.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: I'm just going to follow up and I will let you respond to that, because there's a lot there.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: But we're talking about racial healing in this segment.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: What do you say to Americans, people of color who...

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: (CROSSTALK)  TRUMP: Well, it was very I say nothing.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: I say nothing, because I was able to get him to produce it.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: He should have produced it a long time before.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: When you talk about healing, I think that I've developed very, very good relationships over the last little while with the African-American community.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And I feel that they really wanted me to come to that conclusion.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And I think I did a great job and a great service not only for the country, but even for the president, in getting him to produce his birth certificate.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: Secretary Clinton?

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: Well, just listen to what you heard.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: (LAUGHTER)  And clearly, as Donald just admitted, he knew he was going to stand on this debate stage, and Lester Holt was going to be asking us questions, so he tried to put the whole racist birther lie to bed.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: But it can't be dismissed that easily.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: He has really started his political activity based on this racist lie that our first black president was not an American citizen.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: There was absolutely no evidence for it, but he persisted, he persisted year after year, because some of his supporters, people that he was trying to bring into his fold, apparently believed it or wanted to believe it.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: But, remember, Donald started his career back in 1973 being sued by the Justice Department for racial discrimination because he would not rent apartments in one of his developments to African-Americans, and he made sure that the people who worked for him understood that was the policy.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: He actually was sued twice by the Justice Department.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: So he has a long record of engaging in racist behavior.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And the birther lie was a very hurtful one.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: You know, Barack Obama is a man of great dignity.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: But I like to remember what Michelle Obama said in her amazing speech at our Democratic National Convention: When they go low, we go high.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And Barack Obama went high, despite Donald Trump's best efforts to bring him down.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: Mr. Trump, you can respond and we're going to move on to the next segment.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: I would love to respond.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: First of all, I got to watch in preparing for this some of your debates against Barack Obama.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: You treated him with terrible disrespect.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And I watched the way you talk now about how lovely everything is and how wonderful you are.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: It doesn't work that way.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: You were after him, you were trying to you even sent out or your campaign sent out pictures of him in a certain garb, very famous pictures.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: I don't think you can deny that.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: But just last week, your campaign manager said it was true.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: So when you tried to act holier than thou, it really doesn't work.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: It really doesn't.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: Now, as far as the lawsuit, yes, when I was very young, I went into my father's company, had a real estate company in Brooklyn and Queens, and we, along with many, many other companies throughout the country it was a federal lawsuit were sued.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: We settled the suit with zero with no admission of guilt.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: It was very easy to do.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: I notice you bring that up a lot.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And, you know, I also notice the very nasty commercials that you do on me in so many different ways, which I don't do on you.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: Maybe I'm trying to save the money.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: But, frankly, I look I look at that, and I say, isn't that amazing?

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: Because I settled that lawsuit with no admission of guilt, but that was a lawsuit brought against many real estate firms, and it's just one of those things.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: I'll go one step further.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: In Palm Beach, Florida, tough community, a brilliant community, a wealthy community, probably the wealthiest community there is in the world, I opened a club, and really got great credit for it.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: No discrimination against African- Americans, against Muslims, against anybody.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And it's a tremendously successful club.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And I'm so glad I did it.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And I have been given great credit for what I did.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And I'm very, very proud of it.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: And that's the way I feel.

links.episode_name: Obama’s legitimacy as an American citizen
links.text: That is the true way I feel.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Our next segment is called Securing America.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We want to start with a 21st century war happening every day in this country.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Our institutions are under cyber attack, and our secrets are being stolen.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: So my question is, who's behind it?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And how do we fight it?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Secretary Clinton, this answer goes to you.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Well, I think cyber security, cyber warfare will be one of the biggest challenges facing the next president, because clearly we're facing at this point two different kinds of adversaries.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: There are the independent hacking groups that do it mostly for commercial reasons to try to steal information that they can use to make money.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But increasingly, we are seeing cyber attacks coming from states, organs of states.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: The most recent and troubling of these has been Russia.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: There's no doubt now that Russia has used cyber attacks against all kinds of organizations in our country, and I am deeply concerned about this.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I know Donald's very praiseworthy of Vladimir Putin, but Putin is playing a really...

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: (CROSSTALK)  CLINTON: ... tough, long game here.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And one of the things he's done is to let loose cyber attackers to hack into government files, to hack into personal files, hack into the Democratic National Committee.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And we recently have learned that, you know, that this is one of their preferred methods of trying to wreak havoc and collect information.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We need to make it very clear whether it's Russia, China, Iran or anybody else.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: The United States has much greater capacity and we are not going to sit idly by and permit state actors to go after our information, our private-sector information or our public-sector information.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And we're going to have to make it clear that we don't want to use the kinds of tools that we have.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We don't want to engage in a different kind of warfare.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But we will defend the citizens of this country.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And the Russians need to understand that.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I think they've been treating it as almost a probing, how far would we go, how much would we do.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And that's why I was so I was so shocked when Donald publicly invited Putin to hack into Americans.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It's one of the reasons why 50 national security officials who served in Republican information in administrations...

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Your two minutes have expired.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: ... have said that Donald is unfit to be the commander- in-chief.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It's comments like that that really worry people who understand the threats that we face.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Mr. Trump, you have two minutes and the same question.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Who's behind it?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And how do we fight it?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I do want to say that I was just endorsed and more are coming next week it will be over 200 admirals, many of them here admirals and generals endorsed me to lead this country.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: That just happened, and many more are coming.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And I'm very proud of it.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: In addition, I was just endorsed by ICE.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: They've never endorsed anybody before on immigration.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I was just endorsed by ICE.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I was just recently endorsed 16,500 Border Patrol agents.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: So when Secretary Clinton talks about this, I mean, I'll take the admirals and I'll take the generals any day over the political hacks that I see that have led our country so brilliantly over the last 10 years with their knowledge.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Because look at the mess that we're in.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Look at the mess that we're in.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: As far as the cyber, I agree to parts of what Secretary Clinton said.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We should be better than anybody else, and perhaps we're not.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I don't think anybody knows it was Russia that broke into the DNC.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: She's saying Russia, Russia, Russia, but I don't maybe it was.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I mean, it could be Russia, but it could also be China.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It could also be lots of other people.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It also could be somebody sitting on their bed that weighs 400 pounds, OK?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: You don't know who broke in to DNC.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But what did we learn with DNC?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We learned that Bernie Sanders was taken advantage of by your people, by Debbie Wasserman Schultz.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Look what happened to her.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But Bernie Sanders was taken advantage of.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: That's what we learned.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Now, whether that was Russia, whether that was China, whether it was another country, we don't know, because the truth is, under President Obama we've lost control of things that we used to have control over.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We came in with the Internet, we came up with the Internet, and I think Secretary Clinton and myself would agree very much, when you look at what ISIS is doing with the Internet, they're beating us at our own game.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: So we have to get very, very tough on cyber and cyber warfare.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It is it is a huge problem.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I have a son, he’s 10 years old.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: He has computers.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: He is so good with these computers, it's unbelievable.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: The security aspect of cyber is very, very tough.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And maybe it's hardly doable.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But I will say, we are not doing the job we should be doing.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But that's true throughout our whole governmental society.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We have so many things that we have to do better, Lester, and certainly cyber is one of them.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Secretary Clinton?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Well, I think there are a number of issues that we should be addressing.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I have put forth a plan to defeat ISIS.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It does involve going after them online.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I think we need to do much more with our tech companies to prevent ISIS and their operatives from being able to use the Internet to radicalize, even direct people in our country and Europe and elsewhere.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But we also have to intensify our air strikes against ISIS and eventually support our Arab and Kurdish partners to be able to actually take out ISIS in Raqqa, end their claim of being a Caliphate.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We're making progress.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Our military is assisting in Iraq.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And we're hoping that within the year we 'll be able to push ISIS out of Iraq and then, you know, really squeeze them in Syria.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But we have to be cognizant of the fact that they've had foreign fighters coming to volunteer for them, foreign money, foreign weapons, so we have to make this the top priority.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And I would also do everything possible to take out their leadership.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I was involved in a number of efforts to take out Al Qaida leadership when I was secretary of state, including, of course, taking out bin Laden.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And I think we need to go after Baghdadi, as well, make that one of our organizing principles.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Because we've got to defeat ISIS, and we've got to do everything we can to disrupt their propaganda efforts online.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: You mention ISIS, and we think of ISIS certainly as over there, but there are American citizens who have been inspired to commit acts of terror on American soil, the latest incident, of course, the bombings we just saw in New York and New Jersey, the knife attack at a mall in Minnesota, in the last year, deadly attacks in San Bernardino and Orlando.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I'll ask this to both of you.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Tell us specifically how you would prevent homegrown attacks by American citizens, Mr. Trump?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Well, first I have to say one thing, very important.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Secretary Clinton is talking about taking out ISIS.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We will take out ISIS. Well, President Obama and Secretary Clinton created a vacuum the way they got out of Iraq, because they got out what, they shouldn't have been in, but once they got in, the way they got out was a disaster.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And ISIS was formed.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: So she talks about taking them out.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: She's been doing it a long time.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: She's been trying to take them out for a long time.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But they wouldn't have even been formed if they left some troops behind, like 10,000 or maybe something more than that.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And then you wouldn't have had them.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Or, as I've been saying for a long time, and I think you 'll agree, because I said it to you once, had we taken the oil and we should have taken the oil ISIS would not have been able to form either, because the oil was their primary source of income.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And now they have the oil all over the place, including the oil a lot of the oil in Libya, which was another one of her disasters.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Secretary Clinton?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Well, I hope the fact-checkers are turning up the volume and really working hard.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Donald supported the invasion of Iraq.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: That is absolutely proved over and over again.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: He actually advocated for the actions we took in Libya and urged that Gadhafi be taken out, after actually doing some business with him one time.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But the larger point and he says this constantly is George W. Bush made the agreement about when American troops would leave Iraq, not Barack Obama.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And the only way that American troops could have stayed in Iraq is to get an agreement from the then-Iraqi government that would have protected our troops, and the Iraqi government would not give that.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But let's talk about the question you asked, Lester.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: The question you asked is, what do we do here in the United States?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: That's the most important part of this.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: How do we prevent attacks?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: How do we protect our people?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And I think we've got to have an intelligence surge, where we are looking for every scrap of information.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I was so proud of law enforcement in New York, in Minnesota, in New Jersey.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: You know, they responded so quickly, so professionally to the attacks that occurred by Rahami.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And they brought him down.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And we may find out more information because he is still alive, which may prove to be an intelligence benefit.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: So we've got to do everything we can to vacuum up intelligence from Europe, from the Middle East.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: That means we've got to work more closely with our allies, and that's something that Donald has been very dismissive of.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We're working with NATO, the longest military alliance in the history of the world, to really turn our attention to terrorism.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We're working with our friends in the Middle East, many of which, as you know, are Muslim majority nations.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Donald has consistently insulted Muslims abroad, Muslims at home, when we need to be cooperating with Muslim nations and with the American Muslim community.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: They're on the front lines.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: They can provide information to us that we might not get anywhere else.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: They need to have close working cooperation with law enforcement in these communities, not be alienated and pushed away as some of Donald's rhetoric, unfortunately, has led to.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Mr. Trump...

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Well, I have to respond.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Please respond.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: The secretary said very strongly about working with we've been working with them for many years, and we have the greatest mess anyone's ever seen.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: You look at the Middle East, it's a total mess.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Under your direction, to a large extent.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But you look at the Middle East, you started the Iran deal, that's another beauty where you have a country that was ready to fall, I mean, they were doing so badly.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: They were choking on the sanctions.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And now they're going to be actually probably a major power at some point pretty soon, the way they're going.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But when you look at NATO, I was asked on a major show, what do you think of NATO?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And you have to understand, I'm a businessperson.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But I have common sense.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And I said, well, I 'll tell you.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I haven't given lots of thought to NATO.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But two things.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Number one, the 28 countries of NATO, many of them aren't paying their fair share.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Number two and that bothers me, because we should be asking we're defending them, and they should at least be paying us what they're supposed to be paying by treaty and contract.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And, number two, I said, and very strongly, NATO could be obsolete, because and I was very strong on this, and it was actually covered very accurately in the New York Times, which is unusual for the New York Times, to be honest but I said, they do not focus on terror.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And I was very strong.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And I said it numerous times.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And about four months ago, I read on the front page of the Wall Street Journal that NATO is opening up a major terror division.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And I think that's great.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And I think we should get because we pay approximately 73 percent of the cost of NATO.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It's a lot of money to protect other people.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But I'm all for NATO.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But I said they have to focus on terror, also.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And they're going to do that.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And that was believe me I'm sure I'm not going to get credit for it but that was largely because of what I was saying and my criticism of NATO.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I think we have to get NATO to go into the Middle East with us, in addition to surrounding nations, and we have to knock the hell out of ISIS, and we have to do it fast, when ISIS formed in this vacuum created by Barack Obama and Secretary Clinton.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And believe me, you were the ones that took out the troops.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Not only that, you named the day.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: They sat back probably and said, I can't believe it.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Lester, we've covered...

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: No, wait a minute.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We've covered this ground.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: When they formed, when they formed, this is something that never should have happened.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It should have never happened.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Now, you're talking about taking out ISIS.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But you were there, and you were secretary of state when it was a little infant.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Now it's in over 30 countries.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And you're going to stop them?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I don't think so.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Mr. Trump, a lot of these are judgment questions.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: You had supported the war in Iraq before the invasion.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: What makes your...

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I did not support the war in Iraq.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: That is a mainstream media nonsense put out by her, because she frankly, I think the best person in her campaign is mainstream media.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: My question is, since you supported it...

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Just would you like to hear...

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: ... why is your why is your judgment...

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Wait a minute.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I was against the war in Iraq.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Just so you put it out.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: The record shows otherwise, but why why was...

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: The record does not show that.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Why was is your judgment any...

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: The record shows that I'm right.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: When I did an interview with Howard Stern, very lightly, first time anyone's asked me that, I said, very lightly, I don't know, maybe, who knows?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Essentially.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I then did an interview with Neil Cavuto.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We talked about the economy is more important.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I then spoke to Sean Hannity, which everybody refuses to call Sean Hannity.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I had numerous conversations with Sean Hannity at Fox.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And Sean Hannity said and he called me the other day and I spoke to him about it he said you were totally against the war, because he was for the war.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Why is your judgment better than...

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And when he excuse me.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And that was before the war started.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Sean Hannity said very strongly to me and other people he's willing to say it, but nobody wants to call him.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I was against the war.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: He said, you used to have fights with me, because Sean was in favor of the war.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And I understand that side, also, not very much, because we should have never been there.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But nobody called Sean Hannity.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And then they did an article in a major magazine, shortly after the war started.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But they did an article which had me totally against the war in Iraq.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And one of your compatriots said, you know, whether it was before or right after, Trump was definitely because if you read this article, there's no doubt.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But if somebody and I'll ask the press if somebody would call up Sean Hannity, this was before the war started.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: He and I used to have arguments about the war.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I said, it's a terrible and a stupid thing.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It's going to destabilize the Middle East.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And that's exactly what it's done.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It's been a disaster.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: My reference was to what you had said in 2002, and my question was...

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: You didn't hear what I said.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Why is your judgment, why is your judgment any different than Mrs. Clinton's judgment?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Well, I have much better judgment than she does.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: There's no question about that.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I also have a much better temperament than she has, you know?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: (LAUGHTER)  I have a much better she spent let me tell you she spent hundreds of millions of dollars on an advertising you know, they get Madison Avenue into a room, they put names oh, temperament, let's go after I think my strongest asset, maybe by far, is my temperament.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I have a winning temperament.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I know how to win.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Secretary Clinton?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: The AFL-CIO the other day, behind the blue screen, I don't know who you were talking to, Secretary Clinton, but you were totally out of control.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I said, there's a person with a temperament that's got a problem.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Secretary Clinton?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: (LAUGHTER)  Let's talk about two important issues that were briefly mentioned by Donald, first, NATO.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: You know, NATO as a military alliance has something called Article 5, and basically it says this: An attack on one is an attack on all.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And you know the only time it's ever been invoked?

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: After 9/11, when the 28 nations of NATO said that they would go to Afghanistan with us to fight terrorism, something that they still are doing by our side.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: With respect to Iran, when I became secretary of state, Iran was weeks away from having enough nuclear material to form a bomb.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: They had mastered the nuclear fuel cycle under the Bush administration.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: They had built covert facilities.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I voted for every sanction against Iran when I was in the Senate, but it wasn't enough.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: So I spent a year-and-a-half putting together a coalition that included Russia and China to impose the toughest sanctions on Iran.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And we did drive them to the negotiating table.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And my successor, John Kerry, and President Obama got a deal that put a lid on Iran's nuclear program without firing a single shot.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: That's diplomacy.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: That's coalition-building.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: That's working with other nations.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: The other day, I saw Donald saying that there were some Iranian sailors on a ship in the waters off of Iran, and they were taunting American sailors who were on a nearby ship.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: He said, you know, if they taunted our sailors, I'd blow them out of the water and start another war.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: That's not good judgment.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: That would not start a war.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: That is not the right temperament to be commander-in- chief, to be taunted.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And the worst part...

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: No, they were taunting us.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: ... of what we heard Donald say has been about nuclear weapons.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: He has said repeatedly that he didn't care if other nations got nuclear weapons, Japan, South Korea, even Saudi Arabia.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It has been the policy of the United States, Democrats and Republicans, to do everything we could to reduce the proliferation of nuclear weapons.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: He even said, well, you know, if there were nuclear war in East Asia, well, you know, that's fine...

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: ... have a good time, folks.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It's lies.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And, in fact, his cavalier attitude about nuclear weapons is so deeply troubling.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: That is the number-one threat we face in the world.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: And it becomes particularly threatening if terrorists ever get their hands on any nuclear material.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: So a man who can be provoked by a tweet should not have his fingers anywhere near the nuclear codes, as far as I think anyone with any sense about this should be concerned.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: That line's getting a little bit old, I must say.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It's a good one, though.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It well describes the problem.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: (LAUGHTER)  TRUMP: It's not an accurate one at all.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It's not an accurate one.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: So I just want to give a lot of things and just to respond.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I agree with her on one thing.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: The single greatest problem the world has is nuclear armament, nuclear weapons, not global warming, like you think and your your president thinks.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Nuclear is the single greatest threat.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Just to go down the list, we defend Japan, we defend Germany, we defend South Korea, we defend Saudi Arabia, we defend countries.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: They do not pay us.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: But they should be paying us, because we are providing tremendous service and we're losing a fortune.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: That's why we're losing we're losing we lose on everything.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: I say, who makes these we lose on everything.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: All I said, that it's very possible that if they don't pay a fair share, because this isn't 40 years ago where we could do what we're doing.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We can't defend Japan, a behemoth, selling us cars by the million...

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We need to move on.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: Well, wait, but it's very important.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: All I said was, they may have to defend themselves or they have to help us out.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: We're a country that owes $20 trillion.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: As far as the nuclear is concerned, I agree.

links.episode_name: Defending the US in the modern day
links.text: It is the single greatest threat that this country has.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Which leads to my next question, as we enter our last segment here (inaudible) the subject of securing America.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: On nuclear weapons, President Obama reportedly considered changing the nation's longstanding policy on first use.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Do you support the current policy?

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Mr. Trump, you have two minutes on that.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Well, I have to say that, you know, for what Secretary Clinton was saying about nuclear with Russia, she's very cavalier in the way she talks about various countries.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: But Russia has been expanding their they have a much newer capability than we do.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: I looked the other night.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: I was seeing B-52s, they're old enough that your father, your grandfather could be flying them.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: We are not we are not keeping up with other countries.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: I would like everybody to end it, just get rid of it.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: I think that once the nuclear alternative happens, it's over.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: At the same time, we have to be prepared.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: I can't take anything off the table.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Because you look at some of these countries, you look at North Korea, we're doing nothing there.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: China should solve that problem for us.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: China should go into North Korea.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: China is totally powerful as it relates to North Korea.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: And by the way, another one powerful is the worst deal I think I've ever seen negotiated that you started is the Iran deal.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Iran is one of their biggest trading partners.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Iran has power over North Korea.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: And when they made that horrible deal with Iran, they should have included the fact that they do something with respect to North Korea.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: And they should have done something with respect to Yemen and all these other places.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: And when asked to Secretary Kerry, why didn't you do that?

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Why didn't you add other things into the deal?

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: One of the great giveaways of all time, of all time, including $400 million in cash.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: That turned out to be wrong.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: It was actually $1.7 billion in cash, obviously, I guess for the hostages.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: So you say to yourself, why didn't they make the right deal?

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: This is one of the worst deals ever made by any country in history.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: The deal with Iran will lead to nuclear problems.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: All they have to do is sit back 10 years, and they don't have to do much.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Your two minutes is expired.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: And they're going to end up getting nuclear.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: I met with Bibi Netanyahu the other day.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Believe me, he's not a happy camper.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Mrs. Clinton, Secretary Clinton, you have two minutes.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Well, let me let me start by saying, words matter.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Words matter when you run for president.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: And they really matter when you are president.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: And I want to reassure our allies in Japan and South Korea and elsewhere that we have mutual defense treaties and we will honor them.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: It is essential that America's word be good.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: And so I know that this campaign has caused some questioning and worries on the part of many leaders across the globe.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: I've talked with a number of them.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: But I want to on behalf of myself, and I think on behalf of a majority of the American people, say that, you know, our word is good.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: It's also important that we look at the entire global situation.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: There's no doubt that we have other problems with Iran.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: But personally, I'd rather deal with the other problems having put that lid on their nuclear program than still to be facing that.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: And Donald never tells you what he would do.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Would he have started a war?

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Would he have bombed Iran?

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: If he's going to criticize a deal that has been very successful in giving us access to Iranian facilities that we never had before, then he should tell us what his alternative would be.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: But it's like his plan to defeat ISIS.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: He says it's a secret plan, but the only secret is that he has no plan.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: So we need to be more precise in how we talk about these issues.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: People around the word follow our presidential campaigns so closely, trying to get hints about what we will do.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Are we going to lead the world with strength and in accordance with our values?

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: That's what I intend to do.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: I intend to be a leader of our country that people can count on, both here at home and around the world, to make decisions that will further peace and prosperity, but also stand up to bullies, whether they're abroad or at home.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: We cannot let those who would try to destabilize the world to interfere with American interests and security...

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Your two minutes is...

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: ... to be given any opportunities at all.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: ... is expired.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Lester, one thing I'd like to say.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Very quickly.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Twenty seconds.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: I will go very quickly.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: But I will tell you that Hillary will tell you to go to her website and read all about how to defeat ISIS, which she could have defeated by never having it, you know, get going in the first place.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Right now, it's getting tougher and tougher to defeat them, because they're in more and more places, more and more states, more and more nations.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: Mr. Trump...

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: And it's a big problem.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: And as far as Japan is concerned, I want to help all of our allies, but we are losing billions and billions of dollars.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: We cannot be the policemen of the world.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: We cannot protect countries all over the world...

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: ... where they're not paying us what we need.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: We have just a few final questions...

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: And she doesn't say that, because she's got no business ability.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: We need a lot of things.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: But you have to have some basic ability.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: And sadly, she doesn't have that.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: All of the things that she's talking about could have been taken care of during the last 10 years, let's say, while she had great power.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: But they weren't taken care of.

links.episode_name: Changing the nation’s policy on nuclear weapons
links.text: And if she ever wins this race, they won't be taken care of.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Mr. Trump, this year Secretary Clinton became the first woman nominated for president by a major party.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Earlier this month, you said she doesn't have, quote, a presidential look.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: She's standing here right now, what did you mean by that?

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: She doesn't have the look.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: She doesn't have the stamina.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: I said she doesn't have the stamina.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: And I don't believe she does have the stamina.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: To be president of this country, you need tremendous stamina.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: The quote was, I just don't think she has the presidential look.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: You have wait a minute.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Wait a minute, Lester.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: You asked me a question.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Did you ask me a question?

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: You have to be able to negotiate our trade deals.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: You have to be able to negotiate, that's right, with Japan, with Saudi Arabia.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: I mean, can you imagine, we're defending Saudi Arabia?

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: And with all of the money they have, we're defending them, and they're not paying?

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: You have so many different things you have to be able to do, and I don't believe that Hillary has the stamina.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Let's let her respond.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Well, as soon as he travels to 112 countries and negotiates a peace deal, a cease-fire, a release of dissidents, an opening of new opportunities in nations around the world, or even spends 11 hours testifying in front of a congressional committee, he can talk to me about stamina.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: (APPLAUSE)  TRUMP: The world let me tell you.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Hillary has experience, but it's bad experience.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: We have made so many bad deals during the last so she's got experience, that I agree.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: (APPLAUSE)  But it's bad, bad experience.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Whether it's the Iran deal that you're so in love with, where we gave them $150 billion back, whether it's the Iran deal, whether it's anything you can name you almost can't name a good deal.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: She's got experience, but it's bad experience.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: And this country can't afford to have another four years of that kind of experience.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: We are at we are at the final question.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: (APPLAUSE)  CLINTON: Well, one thing.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: One thing, Lester.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Very quickly, because we're at the final question now.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: You know, he tried to switch from looks to stamina.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: But this is a man who has called women pigs, slobs and dogs, and someone who has said pregnancy is an inconvenience to employers, who has said...

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: .... women don't deserve equal pay unless they do as good a job as men.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: I didn't say that.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: And one of the worst things he said was about a woman in a beauty contest.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: He loves beauty contests, supporting them and hanging around them.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: And he called this woman Miss Piggy.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Then he called her Miss Housekeeping, because she was Latina.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Donald, she has a name.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Where did you find this?

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Where did you find this?

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Where did you find this?

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: And she has become a U.S. citizen, and you can bet...

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: ... she's going to vote this November.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: (APPLAUSE)  HOLT: Mr. Trump, could we just take 10 seconds and then we ask the final question...

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: You know, Hillary is hitting me with tremendous commercials.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Some of it's said in entertainment.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Some of it's said somebody who's been very vicious to me, Rosie O’Donnell, I said very tough things to her, and I think everybody would agree that she deserves it and nobody feels sorry for her.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: But you want to know the truth?

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: Please very quickly.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: ... extremely rough to Hillary, to her family, and I said to myself, I can't do it.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: I just can't do it.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: It's inappropriate.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: It's not nice.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: But she spent hundreds of millions of dollars on negative ads on me, many of which are absolutely untrue.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: They're untrue.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: And they're misrepresentations.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: And I will tell you this, Lester: It's not nice.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: And I don't deserve that.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: But it's certainly not a nice thing that she's done.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: It's hundreds of millions of ads.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: And the only gratifying thing is, I saw the polls come in today, and with all of that money...

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: We have to move on to the final question.

links.episode_name: Clinton not having a “Presidential Look”
links.text: ... $200 million is spent, and I'm either winning or tied, and I've spent practically nothing.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: (APPLAUSE)  HOLT: One of you will not win this election.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: So my final question to you tonight, are you willing to accept the outcome as the will of the voters?

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: Secretary Clinton?

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: Well, I support our democracy.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: And sometimes you win, sometimes you lose.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: But I certainly will support the outcome of this election.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: And I know Donald's trying very hard to plant doubts about it, but I hope the people out there understand: This election's really up to you.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: It's not about us so much as it is about you and your families and the kind of country and future you want.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: So I sure hope you will get out and vote as though your future depended on it, because I think it does.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: Mr. Trump, very quickly, same question.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: Will you accept the outcome as the will of the voters?

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: I want to make America great again.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: We are a nation that is seriously troubled.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: We're losing our jobs.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: People are pouring into our country.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: The other day, we were deporting 800 people.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: And perhaps they passed the wrong button, they pressed the wrong button, or perhaps worse than that, it was corruption, but these people that we were going to deport for good reason ended up becoming citizens.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: Ended up becoming citizens.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: And it was 800.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: And now it turns out it might be 1,800, and they don't even know.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: Will you accept the outcome of the election?

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: Look, here's the story.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: I want to make America great again.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: I'm going to be able to do it.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: I don't believe Hillary will.

links.episode_name: Accepting the outcome as the will of the voters
links.text: The answer is, if she wins, I will absolutely support her.

links.episode_name: Conclusion
links.text: (APPLAUSE)  HOLT: All right.

links.episode_name: Conclusion
links.text: That concludes our debate for this evening, a spirit one.

links.episode_name: Conclusion
links.text: We covered a lot of ground, not everything as I suspected we would.

links.episode_name: Conclusion
links.text: The next presidential debates are scheduled for October 9th at Washington University in St. Louis and October 19th at the University of Nevada Las Vegas.

links.episode_name: Conclusion
links.text: The conversation will continue.

links.episode_name: Conclusion
links.text: The vice presidential debate is scheduled for October 4th at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia.

links.episode_name: Conclusion
links.text: My thanks to Hillary Clinton and to Donald Trump and to Hofstra University for hosting us tonight.

links.episode_name: Conclusion
links.text: Good night, everyone.
